contextId.information: This is a sticky black paste made from petroleum. It can be used to keep out water. AT: "tar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

This is a sticky brown or black paste that can be made from tree sap or from petroleum. Therefore, "pitch" would include not only "bitumen" but also plant-based resins. It too can be used to keep out water. AT: "tar" or "resin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is a musical instrument like a small drum that also has pieces of metal around the side that make a sound when shaken. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Coriander is also known as cilantro. People dry the seeds and grind them into a powder and put it in food to give it flavor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
an oven that can be made extremely hot (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is a gemstone that is blue in color. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
dried plants that people grind into a powder and put in oil or food to give it a nice smell or flavor (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
These are valuable stones that have layers of white and black, red or brown. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
"valuable gems" or "treasured gems." See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is a valuable stone that has layers of white and black, red or brown. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
It not clear what these are. They were objects, possibly stones, that the priest used to determine somehow the will of God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
A pomegranate is a round fruit with a red outer skin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

"20 gerahs." A gerah is a unit that people used for measuring how much something very small weighed. (See:  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

dried plants that people grind into a powder and put in oil or food to give it a nice smell or flavor. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:03|25:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
